Package com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser.patterns

A package for the pattern based tokeniser, which applies supervised machine learning to certain patterns in the text representing ambiguous tokenisation decisions.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    PatternEventStream
    An event stream for tokenising, using patterns to identify potential compounds that need to be examined.
    PatternTokeniser
    The compound pattern tokeniser first splits the text into individual tokens based on a list of separators, each of which is assigned a default value for that separator.
    PatternTokeniserTrainer
    Reads various configuration parameters and enables building a pattern tokeniser model.
    TokeniserPatternManager
    The TokeniserPatternManager will read patterns from a list of strings, typically stored in a file.

    The list of strings should contain default decisions for the various separators, in lines as follows:
    IS_NOT_SEPARATOR -
    IS_SEPARATOR_AFTER '
    IS_SEPARATOR_BEFORE
    All other separators are assumed to separate tokens on both sides (IS_SEPARATOR)

    Next, it should contain a list of patterns.
    Optionally, each pattern can be preceded by a user-friendly name and a tab.
    TokenPattern
    A pattern for analysing whether a particular token is likely to have a TokeniserDecision different from the default for this token.
    When matching a TokeniserPattern, we check if any set of n tokens in a TokenSequence matches it.
    If so, all of the tokens inside the set are to be tested further, unless they have been marked with {} as not for further testing.
    The TokeniserPattern will always match an exact number of tokens in a TokenSequence.
    The number of tokens n to be matched is calculated from the number of separators explicitly included in the TokeniserPattern.
    For example, the pattern "parce que" and "parce qu'" need to be listed separately, as the second one has an additional separator.
    TokenPatternMatch
    A single match for a token on a given TokeniserPattern, giving the index of the match.
    TokenPatternMatchSequence
    A token sub-sequence matching a particular TokenPattern within a larger token sequence (representing a sentence).
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    InvalidTokenPatternException  

Package com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser.patterns Description

A package for the pattern based tokeniser, which applies supervised machine learning to certain patterns in the text representing ambiguous tokenisation decisions.
